description.narrative: Output 3.3: By 2023, quality evidence and data are generated through UNICEF-supported Government programs to ensure child rights monitoring., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Evaluation, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3:By 2023, all children, particularly the most vulnerable, benefit from gender-responsive social policies for the sustainable and equitable realization of their rights.

sector.narrative: Corporate, Regional, multi country, multi region, multi outcome evaluations and joint evaluations

title.narrative: Lesotho United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals
Interagency Humanitarian Response Assessments and Plans
UN Sustainable Development Group Database of Common Country Analyses
UNINFO Document Database to search for Common Country Analysis and Cooperation Framework
UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Lesotho 2021 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.3: By 2023, quality evidence and data are generated through UNICEF-supported Government programs to ensure child rightsmonitoring.

description.narrative: During 2021, UNICEF Lesotho has capacitated;the MoDP;in prioritizing evaluations and using evidence to inform evidence policymaking. The country office;has continued to engage in research and completed together with government and NGO partners three important studies, namely:;a Child Poverty Report, a Nutrition investment case and; 2 UReport polls and one study on the perceptions around COVID - 19 cash transfers supported by UNICEF.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/12/2021

title.narrative: Number of child rights evidence pieces/documents produced and disseminated, Number
